summary: This bill, the "Bringing the Discount Window into the 21st Century Act," mandates the Federal Reserve Board of Governors to review and improve the operations of the discount window, which provides liquidity to financial institutions. The review will assess aspects like technology, cybersecurity, communication, oversight, and interaction with other liquidity providers. The bill requires a remediation plan to address identified deficiencies and regular reports to Congress, including annual reports from the Board and the Inspector General. The Inspector General is of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System and the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection. The bill includes the possibility of a confidential annex for sensitive information like cybersecurity deficiencies.
